data.name: Source Name
data.description: Sources are considered as the starting biological material used in a study.

data.name: Title
data.description: Short text that can be used to call out sample records in search results or in displays.

data.name: Description
data.description: Free-form text describing the sample, its origin, and its method of isolation.

data.name: tax_id
data.description: NCBI Taxonomy Identifier number ID. This is appropriate for individual organisms and some environmental samples.

data.name: organism
data.description: Provide a taxonomic information associated to the Source Biological material (for example, Species, genus, strain,....). Ideally, provide NCBI TaxID or NEWT identifier

data.name: cell_type
data.description: cell type from which the sample was obtained

data.name: dev_stage
data.description: if the sample was obtained from an organism in a specific developmental stage, it is specified with this qualifier

data.name: germline
data.description: the sample described presented in the entry has not undergone somatic genomic rearrangement as part of an adaptive immune response; it is the unrearranged molecule that was inherited from the parental germline

data.name: tissue_lib
data.description: tissue library from which sample was obtained

data.name: tissue_type
data.description: tissue type from which the sample was obtained

data.name: collection_date
data.description: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

data.name: isolation_source
data.description: describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived

data.name: lat_lon
data.description: geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected

data.name: collected_by
data.description: name of persons or institute who collected the specimen

data.name: geographic location (country and/or sea)
data.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).
CVList: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

data.name: geographic location (region and locality)
data.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

data.name: identified_by
data.description: name of the expert who identified the specimen taxonomically

data.name: environmental_sample
data.description: identifies sequences derived by direct molecular isolation from a bulk environmental DNA sample (by PCR with or without subsequent cloning of the product, DGGE, or other anonymous methods) with no reliable identification of the source organism

data.name: mating_type
data.description: mating type of the organism from which the sequence was obtained; mating type is used for prokaryotes, and for eukaryotes that undergo meiosis without sexually dimorphic gametes

data.name: sex
data.description: sex of the organism from which the sample was obtained

data.name: lab_host
data.description: scientific name of the laboratory host used to propagate the source organism from which the sample was obtained

data.name: host scientific name
data.description: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

data.name: bio_material
data.description: identifier for the biological material from which the sample was obtained, with optional institution code and collection code for the place where it is currently stored.

data.name: culture_collection
data.description: institution code and identifier for the culture from which the sample was obtained, with optional collection code.

data.name: specimen_voucher
data.description: identifier for the specimen from which the sample was obtained

data.name: cultivar
data.description: cultivar (cultivated variety) of plant from which sample was obtained

data.name: ecotype
data.description: a population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat.

data.name: isolate
data.description: individual isolate from which the sample was obtained

data.name: sub_species
data.description: name of sub-species of organism from which sample was obtained

data.name: variety
data.description: variety (= varietas, a formal Linnaean rank) of organism from which sample was derived.

data.name: sub_strain
data.description: name or identifier of a genetically or otherwise modified strain from which sample was obtained, derived from a parental strain (which should be annotated in the strain field; sub_strain from which sample was obtained

data.name: cell_line
data.description: cell line from which the sample was obtained

data.name: serotype
data.description: serological variety of a species characterized by its antigenic properties

data.name: serovar
data.description: serological variety of a species (usually a prokaryote) characterized by its antigenic properties

data.name: strain
data.description: Name of the strain from which the sample was obtained.

data.name: submission date
data.description: Date in which sample was submitted to ENA.

data.name: status
data.description: Status of submission to ENA.

data.name: accession
data.description: ENA sample accession code. Provided by ENA after submission.
